Who We Are

HR was broken. We gave it feathers.

Founded by a consortium of African Grey parrots who were "frankly insulted" by traditional recruitment practices, PollyCore™ has grown from a single nesting box in a Reno storage unit to a mobile 14-story corporate campus that physically relocates every 8–16 days.

We realized early on that the best way to retain top talent is to make leaving physically confusing. Our building's unpredictable movements mean your employees literally cannot find the exit. Retention rates: 99.2%.

The casino was added in 2021 after our CEO, Margaret (a 34-year-old Hyacinth Macaw), noted that "if we're already operating without a fixed address, we might as well lean in." The jazz band has been playing since before the company existed. We did not hire them. They were here when we arrived. They will be here after we leave.

By The Numbers

  • 340 full-time employees (280 parrots, 41 humans, 19 "other")
  • Currently in Helsinki (was in Tucson last week)
  • Jazz band: 6 members, none of whom have clocked out since 2019
  • Casino tables: 42 (blackjack, poker, and one mysterious table nobody will explain)
  • Awards: "Most Confusing Workplace" — Forbes, 2024
  • OSHA violations: 114 (pending review, building keeps moving before inspectors arrive)

Our Services

Everything your workforce needs,
plus several things it absolutely does not.

Beak-to-Beak Interviews™

$2,400/session

Our certified parrot interviewers assess candidates using a proprietary method that involves sustained eye contact and the occasional scream. 73% of candidates describe the experience as "transformative." The other 27% could not be reached for comment.

Plumage-Based Personality Assessment

$890/employee

Forget Myers-Briggs. We evaluate your team based on feather condition, wing span, and how they react when a macaw lands on their desk at 7:45 AM. Statistically more accurate than any DISC profile ever administered.

Termination by Cockatoo

$3,100/termination

Our specially trained Moluccan Cockatoo, Dennis, delivers the news so you don't have to. Dennis has terminated over 600 employees. Dennis shows no signs of emotional fatigue. Dennis enjoys his work.

Blackjack (Modified Rules)

$25 minimum

Standard blackjack, except the dealer is a Senegal Parrot named Keith who sometimes eats the cards. If Keith eats your ace, that's a push. House rules. Keith has eaten $40,000 worth of playing cards since November.

The Perch (High-Roller Lounge)

$10,000 buy-in

Located on the 12th floor — or wherever the 12th floor is today. Sunflower seeds and top-shelf tequila complimentary. Dress code: business casual. Plumage: mandatory. Humans must wear at least three feathers.

Table 9

$???

Background Jazz (Default)

Included (cannot be removed)

The band plays at all times. During meetings, during terminations, during blackjack. The saxophonist, Lenny, has not blinked since 2022. We have asked the band to stop. They smile and continue playing.

Foreground Jazz (Upgrade)

$1,200/hr

Same jazz, but louder and the band moves closer to you specifically. The trumpet player will maintain eye contact. This is useful for intimidation-based negotiations and really aggressive quarterly reviews.

Receive real-time coordinates of our building via SMS. Accuracy: ±200 meters. The building sometimes moves between when we send the text and when you read it. We're working on this. The building is not working with us on this.

Pre-Relocation Counseling

$600/session

A trained parrot therapist will help you process the fact that your office is now in a different country. Common feelings include confusion, rage, and a strange sense of freedom. Sessions held wherever the building currently is, obviously.

Relocation Opt-Out

NOT AVAILABLE

If you are inside the building when it moves, you move with it. We added this to the employment contract in 2021 after the Lisbon Incident. 14 employees woke up in Kazakhstan. All 14 were promoted for their flexibility.

Building Relocation Log — 2026

Where we've been. Where we'll be is unknowable.

Jan 3, 2026

Tucson, AZ → Helsinki, Finland

Building departed at 3:17 AM without warning. 23 employees were asleep inside. One was mid-hand at the blackjack table. Keith (the dealer) did not pause. The hand was completed over the Atlantic. Client lost.

Dec 19, 2025

Rural Wisconsin → Tucson, AZ

Fastest relocation on record: 11 minutes. Several employees reported mild nausea. The jazz band played "Fly Me to the Moon." This is the only known instance of the band acknowledging what is happening.

Dec 2, 2025

Dubai, UAE → Rural Wisconsin

Building appeared in the middle of a cornfield at 6:00 AM. Local farmer Dan Ericsson described the event as "concerning." He was offered a job. He accepted. He is now VP of Grain.

Nov 14, 2025

Zurich, Switzerland → Dubai, UAE

Cynthia (VP of Relocation Denial) told clients we were "still in Zurich, just a different part." Dubai is not a different part of Zurich. Client accepted this explanation without question.

Oct 28, 2025

Galveston, TX → Zurich, Switzerland

Building relocated during an all-hands meeting. Margaret continued her presentation without acknowledging the change. Slide 14 referenced "our Galveston headquarters." The Matterhorn was visible through the window. Nobody said anything.

Casino Floor — House Rules

The house always wins. The house also migrates.

01

No Outside Seeds

All seeds consumed on the gaming floor must be purchased from PollyCore™ concessions. Outside seeds will be confiscated. Do not argue with the confiscation parrot. She is not paid enough for this.

02

Card Consumption

If a dealer eats your card, the hand is void. If you eat a dealer's card, you will be escorted out. If Keith eats the entire deck (this has happened twice), all bets are returned minus a 15% "Keith fee."

03

Jazz Volume

The jazz volume is non-negotiable. It increases near Table 9. It increases when someone is being fired. It increases on Wednesdays for no reason we have been able to identify. Bring earplugs if desired. They won't help.

04

Mid-Relocation Gambling

All bets placed before a relocation are honored after the relocation. Chips earned in one country are valid in the next. Your winnings do not change value based on currency exchange. PollyCore™ does not recognize exchange rates.

05

The Perch Dress Code

Business casual. Minimum three feathers (pinned, worn, or surgically attached — we don't ask). Feathers are available for purchase at the gift shop ($8/feather, $45 for a "plumage bundle").

06

Table 9 Policy

There is no policy for Table 9. Table 9 has its own policies. They change. We are not informed in advance. If the table asks you to sit, sit. If it asks you to leave, leave. We take no responsibility.

Live Jazz — Daily Schedule

The band does not take breaks. This is not a choice.

Below is our "schedule." In practice, the band plays what they want, when they want. This document exists for legal reasons.

12:00 AM
"The Midnight Molt"
Slow, ambient jazz that somehow makes the slot machines sadder. Lenny's sax takes on a quality that one Yelp reviewer described as "the sound a building makes when it's thinking about moving."
6:00 AM
"Dawn Feeding Groove"
Up-tempo bebop that coincides with the morning seed distribution. The rhythm section syncs with the sound of 280 parrots eating simultaneously. It's more musical than you'd think.
9:00 AM
"Onboarding Blues"
Played exclusively during new employee orientation. The band follows new hires around the building. The drummer makes eye contact during the benefits presentation. 100% of new hires describe this as "unsettling but correct."
12:00 PM
"Lunchbreak Doesn't Exist"
We tried to give the band a lunch break in 2023. The trumpet player played through a sandwich. The bassist ate while soloing. Lenny does not eat in a way that anyone has been able to observe or document.
3:00 PM
"The 3 PM Escalation"
Volume increases by 40% for no documented reason. Coincides with the building's daily "settling period" where the structure shifts 0.5–3 meters in a random direction. The band does not acknowledge the movement.
6:00 PM
"Termination Hour"
Dennis performs most firings between 6–8 PM. The band plays something beautiful and devastating. Several ex-employees have requested recordings. We don't record the band. Nobody does. Attempts result in blank audio files.

Frequently Asked Questions

We get these a lot. The answers don't help.

Is this a real HR company or a casino?
Yes. We are both. We are a fully licensed HR consultancy AND a fully licensed casino. We are also a jazz venue, though we did not apply for this. The jazz predates us. Our legal team (two parrots and Dave) maintains that these are three separate businesses operating from one building. The IRS disagrees. We have relocated before they can serve papers.
Why does the building move?
We have commissioned four separate studies. The first concluded "unknown geological phenomenon." The second concluded "the building is alive." The third team never returned from inside the building. The fourth study concluded "it just does." We have accepted the fourth conclusion and moved on, much like the building.
Can I visit your office?
You can try. Subscribe to our GPS tracker ($47.99/mo) for approximate coordinates. When you arrive, the building may or may not be there. If it is there, enter through the lobby. If Lenny is playing near the entrance, that means the building is about to move. You have approximately 90 seconds. If you do not make it inside in time, the building will leave without you and you will be standing in an empty lot in Finland. This has happened to 300+ visitors. We do not offer refunds for this experience, though many describe it as "clarifying."
Are your parrots actually qualified to do HR?
Gerald holds a SHRM-SCP certification. Margaret has an MBA from "a university that has since moved" (unverifiable). Dennis has no formal qualifications but maintains a 100% success rate in terminations. No former employee has ever returned after being fired by Dennis. Whether this is because the termination was effective or because the building moved before they could come back is a matter of ongoing internal debate.
Can the jazz be turned off?
No. Please refer to our Jazz Removal policy under Services. To summarize: no. We have tried. In 2022, Margaret directly asked the band to stop. The saxophonist (Lenny) played a 40-minute solo that made Margaret cry. Margaret does not cry. Margaret has bitten through steel cable. Whatever Lenny played, it was beyond us. The jazz stays.
What is Table 9?
We cannot answer this question. Table 9 has requested that we do not answer this question. We did not know tables could make requests. We do not know how Table 9 communicated this. The note appeared on Margaret's desk overnight, written in handwriting that does not match any employee. The note said, simply: "Do not discuss Table 9." It was signed "Table 9." We are honoring this request.
Is Dave okay?
Dave reports that he is "fine." Dave's office is a folding chair between two slot machines. Dave's annual review is conducted in a language he does not understand. Dave has been employee of the month 14 times. Dave does not know why. When asked about his job satisfaction on a scale of 1–10, Dave said "the jazz is nice" and returned to his chair. We believe Dave is fine.
